EditorStartupMap: If set, this map will be loaded when the Editor starts up.
EditorTemplateMapOverrides: Map templates that should show up in the new level dialog. This will completely override the default maps chosen by the default editor
LocalMapOptions: The default options that will be appended to a map being loaded.
TransitionMap: The map loaded when transition from one map to another.
bUseSplitscreen: Whether the screen should be split or not when multiple local players are present
TwoPlayerSplitscreenLayout: The viewport layout to use if the screen should be split and there are two local players
ThreePlayerSplitscreenLayout: The viewport layout to use if the screen should be split and there are three local players
FourPlayerSplitscreenLayout: The viewport layout to use if the screen should be split and there are three local players
bOffsetPlayerGamepadIds:
If enabled, this will make so that gamepads start being assigned to the second controller ID in local multiplayer games.
In PIE sessions with multiple windows, this has the same effect as enabling "Route 1st Gamepad to 2nd Client"
GameInstanceClass: The class to use when instantiating the transient GameInstance class
GameDefaultMap: The map that will be loaded by default when no other map is loaded.
ServerDefaultMap: The map that will be loaded by default when no other map is loaded (DEDICATED SERVER).
GlobalDefaultGameMode: GameMode to use if not specified in any other way. (e.g. per-map DefaultGameMode or on the URL).
GlobalDefaultServerGameMode:
GameMode to use if not specified in any other way. (e.g. per-map DefaultGameMode or on the URL) (DEDICATED SERVERS)
If not set, the GlobalDefaultGameMode value will be used.
GameModeMapPrefixes: Overrides the GameMode to use when loading a map that starts with a specific prefix
GameModeClassAliases: List of GameModes to load when game= is specified in the URL (e.g. "DM" could be an alias for "MyProject.MyGameModeMP_DM")

methods.name: SetSkipAssigningGamepadToPlayer1
